On 9/2/05, Tom Emerson <Tree@...> wrote:
> If you are interested =
in only getting those 7M seeds wouldn't it be
> easier to just write a scri=
pt in Perl to spin over them and fetch the
> content?

Good question.

I re=
ally like the Heritrix GUI.  The JMX integration is a great way to
track th=
e progress of the spider from other processes.  The coming
clustered spider=
ing is a way to go from, say, 7M seeds to 70M seeds. 
We use the ARC files =
on the backend and have written a module that
pulls links out of Heritrix i=
n the way we need 'em.  And we've used
Heritrix to get to the point that we=
 had 7M seeds.

Not that all of those things couldn't be replicated in a si=
mpler
system than Heritrix ... and perhaps should be if our biggest problem=

is figuring out a way to spider 7M seeds.

-matt
